title-group.article-title: Narrating Despair: Baudelaire's Petits Poèmes en prose and Kierkegaard's Will to Ethics

ref.mixed-citation: Marie Maclean contends, in Narrative as Performance: The Baudelairean Experiment (London: Routledge, 1988),
Edward K. Kaplan, Baudelaire's Prose Poems: The Esthetic, the Ethical, and the Religious in The Parisian Prowler (Athens: U of Georgia P, 1990) 2-4.

Edward K. Kaplan, "Solipsism and Dialogue in Baudelaire's Prose Poems," Modernity and Revolution in Late Nineteenth-Century France, ed. Barbara T. Cooper and Mary Donaldson-Evans (Newark: U of Delaware P, 1992) 88-98.
Charles Baudelaire, "Le Peintre de la vie moderne," Œuvres complètes, 2 vols. (Paris: Gallimard-Pléiade, 1975) 2: 685-86.
David Carrier writes in "Baudelaire's Philosophical Theory of Beauty," Nineteenth Century French Studies 23 (Spring-Summer, 1995): 388-90.
Richard D. E. Burton, "Bonding and Breaking in Baudelaire's Petits poèmes en prose," Modern Language Review 88 (1993) 58-73 (68);
J. A. Hiddleston, Baudelaire and Le Spleen de Paris (Oxford: Clarendon P, 1987) 9, 36;
Vivien L. Rubin, "Two Prose Poems by Baudelaire: Le Vieux Saltimbanque and Une Mort héroïque," Nineteenth-Century French Studies 14 (Fall-Winter 1985-86) 51-60 (52, 55).
Søren Kierkegaard, Either/Or, 2 vols., ed. and trans. Howard V. Hong and Edna H. Hong (Princeton: Princeton UP, 1987) 2: 177.
Charles Baudelaire, "Le Spleen de Paris," Œuvres complètes 1: 273-363 (277).
Hiddleston notes that the "implication of the conditional is clear" (8).
Francis S. Heck, "Le Mauvais Vitrier: A Literary Transfiguration, Nineteenth-Century French Studies 14 (Spring-Summer, 1986) 260-68 (262).

Katherine Golsan has written a fascinating comparison of Manet and Baudelaire that bears noting here: "The Beholder as flâneur: Structures of Perception in Baudelaire and Manet," French Forum 21(1996) 165-86.
Sigmund Freud, The Ego and the Id, trans. James Strachey (New York: Norton, 1960) 37.
Charles Baudelaire, "Notes nouvelles sur Edgar Poe," Œuvres complètes 2: 319-37 (333).
